subject: Technology
title: Binge-Watching: The Death of Appointment TV
description: A micro-lesson that makes Binge-Watching: The Death of Appointment TV usable.

hook.text: Netflix released all 13 episodes of House of Cards at once. Viewers watched them all in a single weekend. Binge culture was born.

buildup.text: Traditional TV released one episode per week. Cliffhangers made you wait seven days. The anticipation was part of the experience.

discovery.text: Dropping entire seasons let viewers consume stories at their own pace. Watching became more like reading a novel.

twist.text: Binge releases kill water-cooler conversation. Everyone's on a different episode, so nobody can discuss the show without spoilers.

climax.text: Some platforms now return to weekly releases. Shared anticipation drives more conversation than dropping a whole season.

punchline.text: We wanted all the episodes at once. Then we missed the wait.

quiz.question: What problem does binge-releasing entire seasons create?
options: Viewers can't discuss episodes without spoiling others who are at different points
